✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good one, very explicit and easy enough to be solved in 5 minutes. Good Job !

I accidentally learned about the Korean method for determining age, after my friend went to teach in Korea and she posted about it.  

I almost couldn't believe it and had to fact-check that she was telling the truth.  I found it fascinating.  It might be worth noting something like "Similar to Korea..." at the beginning of your puzzle.

Nice association - this puzzle was inspired by the traditional Chinese age determining method but uses a similar but different method (to make the puzzle easy). Korea and some other countries have something similar. I'm considering creating harder puzzles around these topics.
"Whenever a person's birthday is, the person's age in years increases by one on the New Year's Day." This applies even though John was just born on the New Year's Day :)
Ah, so New Year's Day is defined as January 1st instead of December 31st? Might need to make that clearer...

In the countries I've stayed, the New Year's Day is always January 1st, and December 31st is New Year's Eve. If it's different somewhere else, please send me a reference, and I'll update the statement accordingly :)
